Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, the fabric is coarse and grey-black in section, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip, slashes of cream-coloured paint, faint traces of eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink survive.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393244) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393244)
